detaileddescription.para: ICE has not been activated for this call or stream
ICE processing has failed
ICE process is in progress
ICE has established a direct connection to the remote host
ICE has established a connection to the remote host through one or several NATs
ICE has established a connection through a relay
Enum describing ICE states.
uPnP is not activate
uPnP process is in progress
Internal use: Only used by port binding
Internal use: Only used by port binding
uPnP is not available
uPnP is enabled
uPnP processing has failed
IGD router is blacklisted
Enum describing uPnP states.
SephoneGlobalState describes the global state of the SephoneCore object. It is notified via the SephoneCoreVTable::global_state_changed
Delivery in progress
Log collection upload successfully delivered and acknowledged by remote end point
Log collection upload was not delivered
SephoneCoreLogCollectionUploadState is used to notify if log collection upload have been succesfully delivered or not.
SephoneGlobalState describes the global state of the SephoneCore object. It is notified via the SephoneCoreVTable::global_state_changed
Sephone core main object created by function sephone_core_new() .
Sephone core SIP transport ports. Use with sephone_core_set_sip_transports
Enum describing Ice states.
Enum describing uPnP states.
SephoneGlobalState describes the global state of the SephoneCore object. It is notified via the SephoneCoreVTable::global_state_changed
SephoneCoreLogCollectionUploadState is used to notify if log collection upload have been succesfully delivered or not.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* SephoneCoreFileTransferRecvCb) (SephoneCore *lc, SephoneChatMessage *message, const SephoneContent *content, const char *buff, size_t size)
memberdef.argsstring: )(SephoneCore *lc, SephoneChatMessage *message, const SephoneContent *content, const char *buff, size_t size)
memberdef.name: SephoneCoreFileTransferRecvCb

detaileddescription.para: File transfer receive callback prototype. This function is called by the core upon an incoming File transfer is started. This function may be call several time for the same file in case of large file.

parameterdescription.para: SephoneChatMessage message from which the body is received.
number of bytes to be read from buff. 0 means end of file.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* SephoneCoreFileTransferSendCb) (SephoneCore *lc, SephoneChatMessage *message, const SephoneContent *content, char *buff, size_t *size)
memberdef.name: SephoneCoreFileTransferSendCb

detaileddescription.para: File transfer send callback prototype. This function is called by the core upon an outgoing File transfer is started. This function is called until size is set to 0. a SephoneContent with a size equal zero

parameterdescription.para: SephoneChatMessage message from which the body is received.
pointer to the buffer where data chunk shall be written by the app
as input value, it represents the number of bytes expected by the framework. As output value, it means the number of bytes wrote by the application in the buffer. 0 means end of file.

This structure holds all callbacks that the application should implement. None is mandatory.

Migrate configuration so that all SIP transports are enabled. Versions of sephone < 3.7 did not support using multiple SIP transport simultaneously. This function helps application to migrate the configuration so that all transports are enabled. Existing proxy configuration are added a transport parameter so that they continue using the unique transport that was set previously. This function must be used just after creating the core, before any call to sephone_core_iterate()
lc
the sephone core
1 if migration was done, 0 if not done because unnecessary or already done, -1 in case of error.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SephoneCoreVTable *vtable, const char *config_path, const char *factory_config_path, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_new

detaileddescription.para: Instanciates a SephoneCore object.

The SephoneCore object is the primary handle for doing all phone actions. It should be unique within your application.
vtable
a SephoneCoreVTable structure holding your application callbacks
config_path
a path to a config file. If it does not exists it will be created. The config file is used to store all settings, call logs, friends, proxies... so that all these settings become persistent over the life of the SephoneCore object. It is allowed to set a NULL config file. In that case SephoneCore will not store any settings.
factory_config_path
a path to a read-only config file that can be used to to store hard-coded preference such as proxy settings or internal preferences. The settings in this factory file always override the one in the normal config file. It is OPTIONAL, use NULL if unneeded.
userdata
an opaque user pointer that can be retrieved at any time (for example in callbacks) using sephone_core_get_user_data().
sephone_core_new_with_config
Main loop function. It is crucial that your application call it periodically.

sephone_core_iterate() performs various backgrounds tasks:
receiving of SIP messages
handles timers and timeout
performs registration to proxies
authentication retries The application MUST call this function periodically, in its main loop. Be careful that this function must be called from the same thread as other libsephone methods. If it is not the case make sure all libsephone calls are serialized with a mutex.
Sets the path to a file or folder containing trusted root CAs (PEM format)
Gets the path to a file or folder containing the trusted root CAs (PEM format)
Specify whether the tls server certificate must be verified when connecting to a SIP/TLS server.
Specify whether the tls server certificate common name must be verified when connecting to a SIP/TLS server.
Retrieves the user pointer that was given to sephone_core_new()
Associate a user pointer to the sephone core.
Destroys a SephoneCore
Sets the database filename where chat messages will be stored. If the file does not exist, it will be created.

This function controls signaling features supported by the core. They are typically included in a SIP Supported header.
lc
the SephoneCore
tag
the feature tag name

Remove a supported tag.
sephone_core_add_supported_tag()
lc
the SephoneCore
tag
the tag to remove

newly allocated vtable

Sets a user data pointer in the vtable.
table
the vtable
data
the user data to attach

Gets a user data pointer in the vtable.
table
the vtable
the data attached to the vtable

Gets the current VTable. This is meant only to be called from a callback to be able to get the user_data associated with the vtable that called the callback.
lc
the sephonecore
the vtable that called the last callback

Destroy a vtable.
vtable
to be destroyed
Instantiates a SephoneCore object with a given SpConfig.

The SephoneCore object is the primary handle for doing all phone actions. It should be unique within your application.
vtable
a SephoneCoreVTable structure holding your application callbacks
config
a pointer to an SpConfig object holding the configuration of the SephoneCore to be instantiated.
userdata
an opaque user pointer that can be retrieved at any time (for example in callbacks) using sephone_core_get_user_data().
sephone_core_new

add a listener to be notified of sephone core events. Once events are received, registered vtable are invoked in order.
vtable
a SephoneCoreVTable structure holding your application callbacks. Object is owned by sephone core until sephone_core_remove_listener.
lc
object
string
identifying the device, can be EMEI or UDID

remove a listener registred by sephone_core_add_listener.
vtable
a SephoneCoreVTable structure holding your application callbacks
lc
object
string
identifying the device, can be EMEI or UDID

core
menc

Set URI where to download xml configuration file at startup. This can also be set from configuration file or factory config file, from [misc] section, item "config-uri". Calling this function does not load the configuration. It will write the value into configuration so that configuration from remote URI will take place at next SephoneCore start.
lc
the sephone core
uri
the http or https uri to use in order to download the configuration.

Get provisioning URI.
lc
the sephone core
the provisioning URI.
Disable a sip transport Use with SCSipTransports
